title: The Institution Evolves
description: A pulmonary case that the current team (cardiology, neurology, internal medicine) may struggle with, triggering a team topology change recommendation.

patient.chief_complaint: Progressive shortness of breath and cough for 3 months
patient.history_of_present_illness: 45-year-old female presents with worsening dyspnea on exertion over 3 months, now occurring with minimal activity. Dry cough for 2 months. Reports fatigue, 8-pound weight loss, and intermittent low-grade fevers. Recently noticed 'bumpy rash' on her shins. Works as a veterinary technician. No recent travel. Denies hemoptysis, orthopnea, or PND.
medications: Albuterol inhaler PRN (started self-treating 1 month ago)
patient.social_history: Veterinary technician. Never smoker. No alcohol. No recreational drugs. Lives with partner and two cats.
patient.family_history: Mother has rheumatoid arthritis. No family history of lung disease.

physical_exam.general: Thin-appearing female, mild respiratory distress at rest
physical_exam.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, no JVD, no peripheral edema
physical_exam.respiratory: Bilateral fine inspiratory crackles at bases. No wheezing.
physical_exam.skin: Erythematous nodular lesions on bilateral shins consistent with erythema nodosum
physical_exam.eyes: No active uveitis on penlight exam
physical_exam.lymph_nodes: Bilateral non-tender cervical and supraclavicular lymphadenopathy

imaging.chest_xray: Bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy. Diffuse reticulonodular opacities in bilateral lung fields.
imaging.CT_chest: Bilateral hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Diffuse micronodular opacities with perilymphatic distribution. No pleural effusion.

timeline.event: Erythema nodosum appears on shins, begins self-treating with albuterol

metadata.known_diagnosis: Pulmonary sarcoidosis (Stage II) with multi-system involvement (lungs, skin, eyes, lymph nodes, calcium metabolism)
teaching_points: Classic sarcoidosis triad: bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy + erythema nodosum + uveitis
Elevated ACE level supports but doesn't confirm sarcoidosis
Hypercalcemia from granulomatous disease (1,25-dihydroxy vitamin D production)

The Constitution Amender should recommend adding a pulmonologist

expected_team_evolution.expected_amendment: Add pulmonologist to active specialist roster
expected_team_evolution.expected_constitution_change: New principle: When >50% of findings fall outside active specialist domains, flag for team topology review
